Q-Wave Costumes and Posters from Lunar New Year for All Parades
Q-Wave
Lunar New Year For All
TAM.685
5 Linear Feet in 2 record cartons, 1 small flat box, 13 oversize flat files, and 1 oversize portfolio
2014-2017 Q-Wave is a community organization dedicated to the support of and advocacy for individuals of Asian and/or Pacific Islander descent who identify as gay, lesbian, bisexual, queer, transgender, gender variant, or questioning. The organization aims to promote visibility and empowerment through various forms of social, political, and educational organizing, including lectures, workshops, film screenings, and participation in public demonstrations. This collection consists of materials created and used for the Q-Wave contingent of the 2014 and 2015 Lunar New Year for All parades in New York City. Materials include a rainbow sash, two sheep costumes to celebrate the Year of the Sheep, and 14 demonstration posters with messages in Chinese, English, and Japanese promoting inclusivity and challenging homophobia and discrimination. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Stephanie Hsu on behalf of Lunar New Year For All in 2015. The accession number associated with this gift is 2016.009. Stephanie Hsu donated an additional 20 posters from the 2017 Lunar New Year for All parade in 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2018.093.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received by the donor.
Historical/Biographical Note
Q-Wave is a community organization dedicated to the support of and advocacy for individuals of Asian and/or Pacific Islander descent who identify as gay, lesbian, bisexual, queer, transgender, gender variant, or questioning. The organization aims to promote visibility and empowerment through various forms of social, political, and educational organizing, including lectures, workshops, film screenings, and participation in public demonstrations like Lunar New Year parades. Q-Wave often collaborates with other groups in their efforts, including The Asian Pride Project, Gay Asian & Pacific Islander Men of New York (GAPIMNY), the National Queer Asian Pacific Islander Alliance (NQAPIA), Project Reach NYC, SALGA-NYC, and Tarab NYC.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Q-Wave Costumes and Posters from Lunar New Year for All Parades; TAM 685; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were moved into archival housing and a collection-level record was created to describe the materials. No arrangement or other physical interventions were performed at this time. In 2018 an accretion of 20 posters was added to the collection and described in the file list as Year of the Rooster Parade Posters.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of materials created and used for the Q-Wave contingent of the 2014 and 2015 Lunar New Year for All parades, a collaborative effort between Q-Wave, Project Reach NYC, and Gay Asian & Pacific Islander Men of New York (GAPIMNY) that encourages participation in Lunar New Year parades in the greater New York City area. Materials include a rainbow sash, two sheep costumes to celebrate the Year of the Sheep, and 14 demonstration posters with messages in Chinese, English, and Japanese promoting inclusivity and challenging homophobia and discrimination.
20 oversize posters added to the collection in 2018 feature signs and artwork from the 2017 Lunar New Year for All parade. Posters contain writing in English and Chinese celebrating the year of the rooster, which feature hand drawn and painted artwork by parade participants.
Conditions Governing Use
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Q-Wave or Lunare New Year For All, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
